title: French Connection finance director Adam Castleton heads for LSL Property Services
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Jul 10, 2015, 11:01 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 29 mins French Connection finance director Adam Castleton heads for LSL Property Services By Jon Yeomans | Telegraph – 1 hour 59 minutes ago +3.6500 
Mr Castleton is joining the property services group after two years at the struggling retailer 
Struggling clothing retailer French Connection (LSE: FCCN.L - news ) is on the hunt for a new finance boss after it announced group finance director Adam Castleton was leaving for LSL Property Services (LSE: LSL.L - news ) . 
Mr Castleton will step down from the board and take up the role of group chief financial officer at LSL in due course, the retailer said today. A search is underway for his successor. 
Mr Castleton joined the clothing group in 2013. 
Ian Crabb, LSL's group chief executive, said Mr Castleton’s “breadth of financial skills and experience” made him a “strong fit” for the company. “I look forward to working with Adam to fully capitalise on the opportunities to further grow and develop LSL's businesses,” he said. 
French Connection moved away from the 'FCUK' branding in 2004 
Mr Castleton started his career with Price Waterhouse in 1989 and has held senior roles at O2 UK, eBay, and The Walt Disney Company (NYSE: DIS - news ) . He will take over from LSL’s interim finance boss Andrew Burchall, who stepped into the role in January after the departure of Steve Cooke to toy-maker Hornby . 
Newcastle-based LSL provides services to the property sector including estate agency, surveying and valuations. 
Since ditching its ‘FCUK’ branding in 2004, French Connection has been struggling to gain momentum . Its shares plunged 20pc in April after it warned its next financial results would be below expectations , despite attempts to refresh its clothing lines. 
The retailer, founded by chairman and chief executive Stephen Marks in 1972, said it would close seven stores this year.
